item.title: 纽约市反犹太主义刺伤袭击的受害者在被捕后大声疾呼
item.description:
A Jewish New Yorker who was stabbed in a brazen antisemitic attack in Brooklyn said Tuesday he’s glad cops have taken the alleged hateful goon off the streets.

“I’m thankful for the hard work and communication of the NYPD,” Elias Rosner told The Post, one day after cops nabbed 23-year-old Armani Charles and charged him with the Dec. 16 hate crime attack in Crown Heights.

“I’m glad that they got him off the street and he can’t hurt anyone else.”

Rosner, 35, a member of the Lubavitch Hasidic community, said last week that he had just left a synagogue when he spotted the assailant walking down the street spewing hateful threats.

“I’m going to kill Jewish people, I’m going to kill a Jew today, I don’t give a f–k,” Rosner recalled the creep saying. “We wouldn’t be in this mess if the Holocaust had happened.”

Rosner said the maniac picked him out of the crowd and targeted him because he “was the one guy that has the bravery to look him in the eye.”

He said he has martial arts training and was able to fend off most of the attack after the fiend pulled a knife.

But he still suffered a deep wound to the chest that came within centimeters of his heart.

The suspect remained on the loose until Monday, when police arrested Charles.

Charles was charged with attempted assault, assault, aggravated harassment and menacing, all as a hate crime, police said.

Sources said he has no prior arrests and no history of mental health issues.

He was awaiting arraignment in Brooklyn Criminal Court Tuesday.

— Additional reporting by Joe Marino
item.author: Reuven Fenton, Jorge Fitz-Gibbon

item.title: 埃里克·亚当斯（ Eric Adams ）抽出雪茄，给出辛辣的两个字的答案，说明他是否会错过担任纽约市市长的机会
item.description:
Mayor Eric Adams whipped out a cigar as he boasted about downing Scotch on a recent trip out of the country and made clear he won’t miss his current gig Tuesday.  

“Someone asked me when I was sitting down, just chatting they said, ‘Are you gonna be miss being mayor?’” he said about his travels to the country of Georgia in response to a Daily News question. “I said, ‘I’m good.’”

Hizzoner, who was elected as a Democrat, will leave office in less than two weeks after he dropped an independent reelection bid in the face of abysmal polling numbers and a depleted donor pool.

Adams, 65, has spent the last stretch of four-year term globetrotting to different nations, including a most recent excursion that took him to Mexico and then Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia.

Adams toured The Telegraph Hotel and helped unveil a New York City suite, according to social media photos posted by the hotel.

But Adams was back in the Big Apple Tuesday to celebrate with Gov. Kathy Hochul at a ceremonial groundbreaking of the Science Park and Research Campus in Kips Bay.

Following the event, Adams showed off a cigar he had while working the room, according to video from the Daily News.

“Had a lot of fun, you know smoked a few cigars, had some single malt and met some good people,” he said in response to a question about his trip.

Before Adams’ recent roughly week-long jaunt, he was out of the country last month for almost nine full days – which would have made Public Advocate Jumaane Williams the acting mayor.

During that trip, he swung by Israel, Albania and Uzbekistan before returning just in time to keep Williams away from temporary power.

Since Adams dropped his bid for mayor in September, he has insisted he can’t wait to move on to the next chapter.

He claimed on Election Day he had to be “stuck on stupid” to want to be mayor for another four years.

His re-election chances started to dissolve last year when he was federally indicted on corruption charges under the Biden administration.

But the case was dropped when President Trump took office, with Adams facing accusations he and the GOP leader struck a deal to stop the prosecution.

Adams has steadfastly denied wrongdoing in the corruption case and insisted he had no quid pro quo with Trump. But he skipped a Democratic Party primary that saw Zohran Mamdani emerge as the winner over a crowded slate.

Mamdani is set to take office on Jan. 1.
item.author: Matthew Fischetti, David Propper

item.title: 击败圣诞老人：如果您将圣诞节购物留到最后一刻（再次） ，现在该买什么
item.description:
‘Twas the day before Christmas, and you still haven’t bought gifts for your spouse — nor the rest of the fam (not even a mouse).

No need to panic, though. This last-minute gift guide not only features coveted presents for even the hardest-to-buy-for on your Christmas list, but it also includes gifts that are still in stock in some of the most popular, central Manhattan stores.

However, with most stores closing by 6 p.m., you’ll only have a 12-hour window left to check everyone — naughty and nice — off your shopping list.

So forget the unoriginal gift cards or an envelope of money that will most likely be tossed aside — and possibly forgotten — and instead, snag one (or many) of the items included in this all-inclusive, last-minute holiday gift guide to fool your loved ones into thinking you put a ton of thought and consideration into your holiday shopping this year.

Get going, though, because the clock is ticking.

Sephora

1513 Broadway | Christmas Eve hours: 7 a.m.-6 p.m.

For your Gen Alpha niece who’s cooler than you

(All in stock at this location)

  • Summer Fridays Lip Butter Balm, $24

This moisturizing lip treatment is a surefire way to turn your tween’s perpetual pout into a smile. Infused with shea and murumuru butters, the soothing formula coats lips with a healthy-looking wash of color and shine. It also comes in 10 colors and can be applied as an overnight mask for extra nourishment.

  • Haus Labs by Lady Gaga Bio-Radiant Glassy Balm Highlighter Stick, $30

Help your favorite girl get her glow on this holiday season with this balm highlighter from Lady Gaga’s brand Haus Labs. The high-shine stick (which comes in six dazzling shades) utilizes moisturizing hyaluronic acid and skin barrier-protecting wakame extract that can be applied to cheeks, lips and eyes to create a glass skin effect. 

  • Sol de Janeiro Cheirosa 40 Beija Flor Hair & Body Perfume Mist, $26–$39

Looking for a gift that will make the tween in your life happy? This fan-favorite hair and body perfume mist from bestselling brand Sol de Janeiro is a surefire way to do just that. The subtle yet delicious-smelling fragrance combines notes of black amber, plum, vanilla woods and jasmine bloom to create a scent that will make her reminisce about warm, summer days, even in the middle of winter.

For grandma, who could use a fragrance update

(All in stock at this location)

  • Miu Miu Miutine Eau de Parfum with Strawberry & Vanilla, $36–$172

Fragrances that tend to appeal to mature women sometimes get a bad rap — which this modern strawberry and vanilla-scented eau de parfum turns straight on its head. With key notes of wild strawberry, gardenia, brown sugar and vanilla accord, the signature scent has a gourmand flavor that’ll make the women in your life feel like a million bucks.

  • Gucci Mini Duo Floral Gorgeous Gardenia Perfume Gift Set, $39

For the Nana who is a creature of habit when it comes to her fragrance selection, this perfume duo set is the perfect compromise. Gucci Flora Gorgeous Gardenia gives off the floral scent of a gardenia’s first blossom, while Gucci Flora Gorgeous Gardenia Intense gives off a bolder, more woody vibe. Notes of pear and brown sugar round out the formulations — you can’t go wrong with either.

  • Burberry Goddess Eau de Parfum with Vanilla & Lavender, $40–$181

Finding a fragrance that matches your grandmother’s heart of gold is essential — and this Burberry Goddess Eau de Parfum fits the bill. The vanilla-based perfume is vegan and includes woody tones, along with lavender. Plus, the elegant gold bottle will look gorgeous on her nightstand.

Macy’s Herald Square

151 W. 34th St. | Christmas Eve hours: 9 a.m.-6 p.m.

For the dad who has enough fine leather goods, ties and socks

(All in stock at this location)

  • The North Face Men’s Canyonlands Half-Zip Fleece Jacket, $80

Half-quarter zips have been all the rage in men’s fashion lately, so why not update dad’s wardrobe with one? This fleece jacket from The North Face is a sporty take on the look. Its secure-zip hand pockets ensure his valuables will stay safe as he braves the outdoors (or snoozes on the couch).

  • Men’s Black Diamond Bracelet in Nylon and Stainless Steel, $120 (reg. $300)

For the Pop who wants to look poppin’, this stylish men’s bracelet is the way to go. With a nylon band and stainless steel accents, this fine piece of jewelry adds a touch of class to any outfit — especially with its row of single-cut black diamonds that add an elevated finishing touch.

  • Chanel Bleu de Chanel Eau de Parfum Spray, $132–$205

Whether your father-in-law is the quick swipe of deodorant and done kind of guy or he’s a cologne snob, this eau de parfum spray from Chanel is sure to appeal to his senses. The fresh, clean scent has notes of citrus and a woodsy feel.

For the mom who does it all 

(All in stock at this location)

  • Lauren Ralph Lauren Long Sleeve Notch Collar Long Pant Pajama Set, $74

After all the holiday hustle and bustle, moms need a break. To help her feel comfortable and relaxed, gift her this classic Lauren Ralph Lauren pajama set. The polished set features a classy collar and comes in two eye-catching patterns (paisley and striped). It’s made from soft cotton-viscose sateen fabric.

  • NEST New York Holiday 3-Wick Candle, $88

For the mom who always makes sure her home smells divine, you can’t go wrong gifting her this three-wick NEST New York Candle. The holiday-inspired blend of pomegranate, mandarin orange, pine, cloves and cinnamon is captured in a beautiful see-through gold container with wintery, cream-colored wax. 

  • Nutribullet 1200-Watt Ultra Personal Blender and Smoothie Maker, $109.99 (reg. $164.99)

If the woman in your life is always on the go (but prioritizes her health), give her the gift of fueling nutrition with this NutriBullet personal blender. Durable blades ensure that fruits and veggies will be blended to perfection, while the 1,200-watt motor is engineered for quiet use. The ultrasleek design will also look great on her countertop.

Nordstrom

225 W. 57th St. | Christmas Eve hours: 10 a.m.–6 p.m.

For the jet-setting aunt with the best taste

(All in stock at this location)

  • Beis The Carry-On Roller, $268

If Aunt Sue’s already planning that next big trip to Belize, why not make her travel easier with this carry-on roller bag from Beis? The chic luggage features four 360-degree swiveling wheels to ensure rolling through the airport goes as smoothly as possible, along with a TSA-approved combination lock for less security stress. The side handle even includes a weight-limit indicator.

  • Coach Essential Leather Card Holder, $95

If your aunt prefers to travel light, this fashionable Coach leather card holder is the perfect place to store her essentials. With signature logo hardware and two card slots, the rich leather accessory adds an air of luxury to any outing.

  • The Vintage List Set of Two Crystal Martini Glasses, $32.40 (reg. $54)

For the single-and-proud relative who doesn’t need to worry about boisterous children breaking her drinking glasses, this Vintage List set of crystal martini glasses is just the right present. It comes in three designs, depending on her style.

For the husband who swears he doesn’t need anything

(All in stock at this location)

  • Rains Hilo Waterproof Weekend Bag, $110

Next time your husband plans a boys’ trip, help him organize his things with this waterproof weekend bag from Rains. The bag is polyester with a polyurethane coating, meaning it can be machine-washed, ensuring inevitable stains don’t become permanent. The crossbody strap also makes it easier to carry on his shoulders.

  • Dior Sauvage After-Shave Balm, $76

If you’ve ever heard your man complain about razor burn, gift him a luxury shaving experience with this soothing after-shave balm from Dior. Infused with nourishing cactus extract, it eases irritation while leaving skin silky smooth.

  • Carhartt Work in Progress Heather Knit Watch Hat, $28 

Even the manliest of men get chilly sometimes. For those colder days, the guy in your life will be so grateful you gifted him this Carhartt beanie. The seven-gauge knit cap adds an element of warmth and comfort to any outdoor outfit.

JD Sports

1466 Broadway | Christmas Eve hours: 8 a.m.–6 p.m.

For the uncle who just got into running and won’t shut up about it

(All in stock at this location)

  • Sonneti London Essential Hoodie, $40

For morning runs where the air is particularly nippy, make sure your favorite uncle is equipped with this Sonneti London Essential Hoodie to keep him warm. The cotton poly-blended sweatshirt comes in eight hues and is technically unisex, in case you’re also looking to cross your athletic aunt off your holiday shopping list.

  • Men’s Nike Air VaporMax Plus Running Shoes, $220

Aside from just sounding cool, the Men’s Nike Air VaporMax ZPlus Running Shoes are sure to make any man in your life sprint as fast as possible. The shoe features a compression-molded upper for optimal durability and a VaporMax Air sole for a soft, lightweight feel.

  • Men’s Sonetti Quarter Socks (6-Pack), $12

Though it probably won’t be the sexiest gift under the tree, every runner needs durable socks to keep them comfortable on their next sprint. These cotton-blend Sonetti socks do the job with cushioning in high-wear areas and come in two colors — black and white.

For the Pilates princess

(All in stock at this location)

  • Owala FreeSip Water Bottle, 32 oz., $34.99

Make sure your bestie stays refreshed and hydrated during her favorite workout with this Owala water bottle. The 32-ounce BPA-free container has triple-layer insulation, a built-in straw and a dishwasher-safe lid.

  • Women’s Under Armour Emboss Leggings, $55

Support your soul sister in her new Pilates journey by gifting her these embossed leggings from Under Armour. The moisture-wicking leggings control odor to ensure she stays embarrassment-free during class, while the elastic waistband will keep her comfortable and secure.

  • Women’s Nike Sportswear Phoenix Fleece Oversized Crewneck Sweatshirt, $75 

What’s better after a tough workout than curling up in a cozy sweatshirt? This fleece Nike crewneck has an oversized fit for ultimate comfort and features the iconic “swoosh” logo for ultimate style and swag.

GAP

1514 Broadway | Christmas Eve hours: 9 a.m. -7 p.m.

For the seasonal situationship

(All in stock at this location)

  • Relaxed Flannel Shirt, $55 (reg. $69.95)

Whether your situationship is indeed a hot lumberjack (or just gives off those vibes), a flannel shirt like this pick from GAP is the perfect way to amp up his look. With a button-front, patch pocket on the chest and subtle plaid pattern, this shirt gives off an effortlessly cool feel.

  • CashSoft Scarf, $31 (reg. $39.95)

For your next outdoor winter date, make sure your beau stays toasty with this ultrasoft scarf. The plush accessory features midweight yarn and is finished with a special brushing technique.

  • CashSoft Crew Socks, $6 (reg. $15.95)

Socks: We all need them, even your potential partner. This pair comes in seven standout shades and is made from GAP’s signature CashSoft fabric. They can be machine-washed.

For the perpetually cold sister

(All in stock at this location)

  • Cotton-Blend Relaxed Crewneck Sweater, $63 (reg. $79.95)

For that next family picture your mom wants out in the snow, make sure your sister stays snug with this cotton-blend crewneck sweater. It has a relaxed fit and comes in petite, regular and tall sizing to ensure there’s the right fit for everyone.

  • Leopard Faux Fur Coat, $160 (reg. $268)

Let your sister keep her fashionista status in the fam, even when it’s chilly. This leopard faux fur coat has a relaxed fit, oversized collar and side pockets. Maybe throw in a pair of coordinating gloves for an extra chic look.

  • VintageSoft Baggy Wide-Leg Sweatpants, $47 (reg. $59.95)

After your dad’s famous Christmas dinner, sweatpants are the name of the game. This wide-leg pair is made from a soft cotton blend and has inner drawcords in the waistband, and has a classic silhouette that makes them look elevated while still feeling comfortable. 

Target

1201 3rd Ave. | Christmas Eve hours: 7 a.m.-8 p.m.

For the cousins who already have everything

(All in stock at this location)

  • Kirby Air Riders, Nintendo Switch 2, $69.99

For gamers who have (or are expecting) the Nintendo Switch 2, this Kirby Air Riders game is a great gift addition. Players can help Kirby and his crew race in arena battles and even fly through the air. Each rider also has their own stats and special abilities.

  • Beats Pill Wireless Bluetooth Speaker, $99.99 (reg. $149.99) 

To make gaming with the family a real party, pump up the volume with this Beats Pill Wireless Bluetooth Speaker. The device features upgraded acoustics and a more prominent bass and comes in four sleek colors.

  • Ghost of Yotei – PlayStation 5, $69.99 

The new PS5 owner in the family is sure to appreciate this enchanting game. The story follows Atsu, a lone mercenary in feudal-era Japan. Help her explore new lands and heal from a traumatic past on this all-encompassing journey.

For the kids with an overflowing toybox

(All in stock at this location)

  • LEGO Icons Succulents Plants and Flowers Set, $39.99

Give the child with a growing green thumb this leafy Lego set. Players can build nine different types of succulents. Plus, it makes a beautiful addition to any home — that doesn’t have to be watered to be admired and enjoyed.

  • Target Toy Shopping Cart, $16.99 (reg. $19.99)

Get the next generation of Target shoppers started young with this play shopping cart set. Little shoppers can enjoy picking up fake groceries — while they sip a pretend Target coffee, of course. There’s even a child seat in the cart for a baby doll.

  • Ravensburger Disney Villainous Unstoppable! Family Board Game, $19.99

For the Disney fanatic in your life, let them see what it’s like to be the villain with this Ravensburger Disney Villainous UnStoppable! Family Board Game. Play as Maleficent, Ursula, Hades or Scar and see who can properly execute their evil plan the fastest. Designed for ages 7 and up.
